alert.note: Alert for Cache Valley, Utah Portion; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:43PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cache County through 430 PM MDT... At 341 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lewiston, or 8 miles south of Preston, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lewiston, Clarkston, Trenton, Richmond, Amalga, Cornish and Beaver Mountain. This includes US Route 89 near mile marker 484. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cache Valley, Utah Portion; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North
